data.text:
More & more countries are increasing their #ClimateAction plans in order to limit global temperature rise and tackle the climate crisis.  

Find out where your country stands in the #RaceToZero greenhouse gas emissions: https://t.co/MSAJURN6nQ https://t.co/chhSApBP2I

📷: The UN emblem - pictured here in the #UNGA Hall at UNHQ in NYC - depicts a top-down view of the globe with two olive branches symbolizing peace.

Learn more ahead of Sunday's #UNDay. https://t.co/y8LubuuzXf https://t.co/dgyJTOrdFY

The war in Yemen has reached a heartbreaking milestone with 10,000 children now killed or maimed.

4 out of 5 children are in need of humanitarian assistance warns @UNICEF, calling for urgent funding to support those in need. 

https://t.co/cn1EpXtd7o

“Israeli and Palestinian civilians are suffering and paying a steep price for the persistence of the conflict."

-- UN Special Coordinator for Middle East Peace Process @TWennesland warns of an “increasingly desperate reality.” https://t.co/3X64DZ2oPo

Changing rainfall patterns, rising temperatures & extreme weather contributed to an increase in food insecurity, poverty & displacement in Africa, worsening the crisis triggered by #COVID19.

More in the new @WMO #StateOfClimate in Africa report: https://t.co/TU5VX6C3Mi https://t.co/DiZbTEjKk8

You can't put out half a fire.

The same is true for tackling #COVID19: #OnlyTogether can end this pandemic - by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. 

Because no one is safe until everyone is safe. https://t.co/Yiiqig7Ime

From delivering life-saving vaccines & providing medical equipment to raising awareness, the UN works around the world to help communities in their #COVID19 response.

See examples in our latest @TwitterMoments:
https://t.co/o4HPRHPIC1

Racism is prevalent in all societies. 

But each of us can use our voices to speak out against expressions & acts of racism.

See how YOU can take action to #FightRacism, dismantle racist structures and reform racist institutions: https://t.co/PWxqEMS8La https://t.co/eKO1OsZj3y

Central African Republic: Announcement of ceasefire in the country is a major step towards dialogue, top UN official told the Security Council on Monday, urging continued support for peace & reconciliation efforts. 

https://t.co/TGbBlATMF1

The UN works for everyone, everywhere by: 
🇺🇳 preventing conflict
🇺🇳 vaccinating children
🇺🇳 protecting refugees
🇺🇳 feeding the hungry
🇺🇳 addressing the climate crisis
🇺🇳 empowering women
🇺🇳 responding to #COVID19 & more.

More ahead of Sunday’s #UNDay: https://t.co/edu8aJsVOg https://t.co/4q8uwqQ1GJ

We need to close the gap between the #ClimateAction steps we need and those we are currently taking. 

Here's how the UN Climate Conference #COP26, can help bridge this ambition gap: https://t.co/EQwt43zK91 via @UNFCCC 
https://t.co/hzvjNfgqEv

Afghanistan: The Taliban have agreed to support a @WHO-led polio vaccination campaign across the country starting next month.

In welcoming the decision, @UNICEF said the new campaign makes a giant stride in efforts to eradicate polio. https://t.co/U6Ddv1sNFR

🚴‍♀️Biking to work
💡Saving electricity 
👗Buying sustainable fashion

Taking #ClimateAction & living more sustainably doesn't have to be difficult.

The #ActNow app helps you reduce your carbon footprint - and have fun doing it: https://t.co/4i2kqgHfrb https://t.co/5VCDAQgABj

Adults and adolescents around the world are not getting enough physical activity, resulting  in an estimated 5 million deaths each year.

@WHO is calling for greater efforts to create active and healthy societies to improve wellness and save lives. https://t.co/R1q2L0ZZVm

#SongForTheSahel is a message of peace to young people.

Mali maestro Vieux Farka Touré's celebrates the resilience of the people of the Sahel - in the face of economic & security crises - in a new musical collaboration with @UNOCHA https://t.co/wp4Z2ngtLv

For more than 2 years, a UN-appointed team has been collecting & analyzing millions of pieces of evidence about possible human rights violations in Myanmar.  

Read about their work: https://t.co/TOhNa4hj9F

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, or war at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum. https://t.co/N62RkE4XnR… via @Refugees https://t.co/qlC5fRojML

Almost 5 trillion single-use plastic bags are handed out every year. Many of them end up polluting our ocean & the environment. 

A simple act like bringing your own reusable bag to do your shopping can help #BeatPlasticPollution. https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y #ActNow https://t.co/oiSYUlUl9V

Racism is abhorrent & ugly, and it plagues our world.

We must reject and condemn it without reservation, without hesitation, without qualification, every time and everywhere.

-- @antonioguterres calls on humanity to come together to #FightRacism. https://t.co/PWxqEMS8La https://t.co/Z1qKvM8hMz

The pandemic is hitting the poor and the most vulnerable the hardest.

Several years of progress in reducing extreme poverty have been lost due to #COVID19, with low-income countries suffering the most. 

More from @WorldBank on #EndPoverty Day. https://t.co/82A3JKSCSZ https://t.co/91oqzBjFW2

We can all play a role in Keeping the Promise of the #GlobalGoals.

Join people around the world in pledging your support for creating a better future for all. 

Make your promise & share your photo to inspire others! https://t.co/hKdCXOPbA2

Extreme poverty is on the rise, and existing social protection provisions are inadequate, particularly for women with young children. 

More from @UN_Women on Sunday's #EndPoverty Day. https://t.co/OKMDjU5djt https://t.co/JtpVx2xRIL

Better data is key to achieving the #GlobalGoals and saving lives. Yet, data is most scarce where people are most at risk.

UN launches fund to unlock the power of data for crisis prevention & action. https://t.co/1u9DRBrmsj https://t.co/xb9qBsBkSP

#COVID19 led to the first rise in extreme poverty in a generation, with half of the world’s population not covered by any social protection. 

Sunday is the International Day to #EndPoverty. 
https://t.co/HHxpZw1rJa https://t.co/1pkPJvJZg8

For the first time ever, the Human Rights Council recognised access to a healthy & sustainable environment as a universal right last week. 

Here are 6 things you need to know about this historic move for #ClimateAction: 
https://t.co/APWHHicElO

On Sunday's #EndPoverty Day, @UNDESA is calling for more to be done to break the cycle of intergenerational poverty by ensuring:

👶 early childcare support
🏦 basic income for young adults
📚 inclusive education for all, and more.

https://t.co/RbKedk9Q2J https://t.co/sMsiuhZ0I9

Impacts of the climate crisis are felt in every country. Share how they are  affecting you and make your voice heard ahead of the UN climate conference #COP26. 

📢 Speak up for #ClimateAction: https://t.co/AXOWM7MmQc via @UNDP #DearWorldLeaders https://t.co/JM7WPaEEO1

Tons of food are lost or wasted every day, while 1 in 9 people go to bed hungry.

#StopTheWaste by:
🍒 Buying smaller portions
🍲 Eating leftovers
🍽️ Sharing food with others

More tips from @WFP on Saturday's #WorldFoodDay: https://t.co/8f4a2ODtO8 https://t.co/P5UzKMhyRy

No one should have to deal with mental health challenges on their own. Yet, too many children & young people do. 

@UNICEF shares tips on how parents can start the mental health conversation with their kids: https://t.co/5c9Ziys3Pb https://t.co/CAuf8rAcSN

The gender gap in food security has risen dramatically during the pandemic, with more women and girls going hungry.

Rural women can be key actors to achieve #ZeroHunger and all the #GlobalGoals. @UN_Women explains: https://t.co/MFlfRlZeMG #WorldFoodDay https://t.co/Ivs46ZShd8

Breast cancer is the most commonly-diagnosed cancer globally. In 2020, an estimated 2.3 million women were diagnosed with the disease.

Learn more from @WHO during breast cancer awareness month. https://t.co/S8EPCuG4Lg https://t.co/Hv5e9YIWGm

Food is:
🕊️ hope
⚕️ health
🏠 home...

And for the 86.7 million people that @WFP reaches every year, it is the foundation of a full & dignified life.

Saturday is #WorldFoodDay. https://t.co/lv7wfqqETQ https://t.co/LGiStZOa7n

"The perpetrators of this latest crime against civilians exercising their right to freely practice their religion must be brought to justice."

-- @antonioguterres condemns despicable attack on mosque in Kandahar City, Afghanistan.
https://t.co/vdIoqn7psI

While the @UNBiodiversity Conference #COP15 is coming to an end, special @UNStamps will continue featuring the beauty of life on Earth.

Get yours & show your support for #ForNature and #ClimateAction: https://t.co/qwsMS0xh02 https://t.co/RdLlEhhSIJ

Wash your hands...
🤧 after coughing or sneezing
🤒 when caring for the sick
🥪 before eating 
     & more

@WHO has tips on Friday's #GlobalHandwashingDay: https://t.co/0mlW1wpQX6 https://t.co/4t9gPLFz5y

Rural women can help:
🌊 take #ClimateAction
🌳 promote the #GlobalGoals
🥘 achieve #ZeroHunger 
👩‍🌾 #EndPoverty
🦠 respond to #COVID19

On Friday's International Day of #RuralWomen, join us in thanking them & supporting their efforts. https://t.co/MZG1TG1yZh via @UN_Women https://t.co/Ep54IHu2tO

Handwashing is key to protecting yourself & others from #COVID19 & many other diseases. 

Yet, 3 billion people do not have a handwashing facility with water & soap at home.

More from @UNICEF on Friday's #GlobalHandwashingDay: https://t.co/AcMO2gXqx4

"Internal healing is a really big part of external healing & planetary healing."

Yvonne Cuaresma, founder of The Climate Journal & @DoctorKarl talk about emotional responses to the climate crisis in the our #ClimateAction podcast 'No Denying It'.
https://t.co/lBMnaLgHKo https://t.co/vumchzcDb5

#COVID19 has left rural women facing:
👉 restricted mobility
👉 disrupted supply chains
👉 increased unpaid care & domestic work
Yet, they are on the frontlines of the pandemic response. 

More on Friday's International Day of #RuralWomen. https://t.co/MZG1TFJY7J via @UN_Women https://t.co/QTEUBwgc2C

Handwashing is one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of diseases & save lives. 

More on hand hygiene from @WHO on Friday's #GlobalHandwashingDay: https://t.co/0mlW1w8fyw https://t.co/JUEvDiLmGz

"Women's full participation & leadership in public & political life is critical for Afghanistan’s future & long-term development."

-- @UN_Women's Deputy Representative for Afghanistan on the need for sustained support for women & girls. https://t.co/n7DvFiPXQh
Yemen: A comprehensive negotiated political settlement is needed to end the violence in the country once and for all, @OSE_Yemen tells Security Council. https://t.co/qnuxQoDwBq

Deaths from tuberculosis increased for the first time in a decade due to #COVID19, says @WHO. 

Progress in tackling the preventable disease reversed as the pandemic overwhelmed health care systems, preventing vulnerable people from seeking help. https://t.co/vr0Ra3MO64

Everyone has a role to play, from individuals changing their travel habits, to businesses transforming their carbon footprint.

-- @antonioguterres calls for #ClimateAction to build sustainable transport systems for a green, inclusive & equitable future. https://t.co/5AEGnycirE https://t.co/GZ3P9A4qGE

Transport is responsible for a quarter of the world's direct CO2 emissions. It's time to switch gears and start moving in the right direction. 

The UN #SustainableTransport Conference is underway in Beijing. Follow the discussions online: https://t.co/J2uNN84tox https://t.co/V2FdNy3AQ7

Discrimination, bigotry and hate speech are destructive and divisive forces affecting peace and prosperity in all societies. 

To prevent and #FightRacism is to create a better world for all of us.

💡 Get ideas for how YOU can take action: https://t.co/PWxqEMS8La https://t.co/CHhTLGOtUG

Routine eye checks can prevent vision impairment and blindness. 

On Thursday's #WorldSightDay, get details about eye care from @WHO: https://t.co/9TZynRY4lZ https://t.co/yOlSewEShd

Afghanistan: With temperatures dropping, the humanitarian crisis in the country is only worsening warns @Refugees.

Emergency funding is urgently needed to help the 20 million people in need. https://t.co/bS30WQd9BI

Al least 1 billion people worldwide are living with vision impairment because they don't get the care they need.

More from @WHO on Thursday's #WorldSightDay: https://t.co/PSKITBtRVQ https://t.co/0wSLPHtT0C

100+ countries commit to develop & implement effective global framework to put biodiversity on a path to recovery by 2030.  

The Kunming Declaration, adopted on Wednesday at the @UNBiodiversity Conference #COP15, demonstrates critical momentum #ForNature.
https://t.co/4dwUgillT4

Paraguay’s failure to prevent the toxic contamination of indigenous peoples' traditional lands violated their rights. 

Independent @UNHumanRights experts say environmental damages harmed indigenous families, identities, traditions & communities. https://t.co/L5EqEyCFOe

Misinformation is costing lives and prolonging the pandemic. 

#PledgetoPause and take time to verify facts before sharing information online. https://t.co/bxwJ0bqk85 https://t.co/cFwI6CbJDQ

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic by prioritizing the distribution of #COVID19 vaccines.

Wednesday's International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction is an opportunity to stress the need to restore balance with nature & build back better.  https://t.co/yXWzgPkE8H #DRRDay https://t.co/IsJc7nOpF8

From electric cars & buses to biking & walking paths, #SustainableTransport will be key for combating the climate crisis & achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

More in landmark UN transport report. https://t.co/hQIV6IEzss

We must all work together to create a safer and more resilient planet.

On Wednesday's International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction, @UNDRR shares 3 key facts about disasters & the state of our world. https://t.co/yXWzgPCfxh #DRRDay https://t.co/mjVvdHXyBS

Data can help anticipate, prevent & better respond to crises. Yet, major data gaps in emergencies make humanitarian & peace operations less effective. 

UN launches data fund to achieve better insights, decisions & support for the most vulnerable. https://t.co/1u9DRBIXQT https://t.co/klgJFplYMl

"Effective risk reduction relies on international cooperation and global solidarity."

-- @antonioguterres on Wednesday's International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction. https://t.co/ZF9uv0VWi7 #DRRDay https://t.co/DJ9CKjmR2m

In Afghanistan, last month the UN delivered:   
➡️ food assistance to 3.8+ million people,   
➡️ water to 186,000 people, 
➡️ healthcare to 450,000 people & much more. 

More on our efforts to help the Afghan people. https://t.co/dYToAiuMLJ https://t.co/H10NRW7vq9

Early action can save lives & help conserve resources.

On Wednesday's International Day for Disaster Risk Reduction, @UNDRR is calling for greater funding for disaster prevention. https://t.co/yXWzgPCfxh #DRRDay https://t.co/7BjCNULdly

Digital technology can help us save lives, fight hunger, take #ClimateAction & much more.

@WFP explains how innovation has become a key element of its #ZeroHunger mission around the world, bringing them closer to the people they serve. https://t.co/lzf2cQJdBL

Infrastructure is key for #ClimateAction.

Ahead of #COP26, @UNOPS, @UNEP & @UniofOxford call for radical changes in how infrastructure is planned, managed & implemented – to achieve the #ParisAgreement: https://t.co/keR7p3z172 https://t.co/FNd1uJWw0W

Human activity is putting immense pressure on our planet.
Crises like #COVID19, the climate emergency & biodiversity loss demonstrate the negative impacts of our choices.

We must all do our part to work #ForNature. https://t.co/QOdvW9EyRi via @UNDP #COP15 https://t.co/domjvOWdJ0

👩🏽‍🏫 Are you a teacher, a parent or a mentor?

🔎 Are you looking for ways to contribute to a world free of racism and intolerance?

Check out our tips on how to #FightRacism in the classroom & beyond: https://t.co/ImRGVvxQrr

#StandUpForHumanRights https://t.co/JSLzqY9Xaq

Sustainable transport means a cleaner, fairer & safer future for everyone. 🚴🚃 

World leaders will discuss how mobility can contribute to #ClimateAction & the #GlobalGoals at the UN Sustainable Transport Conference in Beijing this week. https://t.co/G6yGH0W5Bu via @UNDESA https://t.co/VLa5fnCNKj

People around the world are coming together to pledge their support for keeping the promise of the #GlobalGoals. 

Make your promise & share your photo to inspire others to help create a better future for all! https://t.co/jtD3sXvpK7 https://t.co/zbuuGfLgjE

#OnlyTogether can we overcome the #COVID19 pandemic. 

Find some inspiring examples of solidarity and kindness in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/cqXuIHDGXy

In Afghanistan, last month the UN delivered:   
• food assistance to 3.8+ million people,   
• healthcare to 450,000 people,
• water to 186,000 people & much more. 

@antonioguterres says the world will pay a heavy price if we do not help Afghans now. https://t.co/yQ59pD1gdf

The climate crisis harms our health.

Ahead of #COP26, @WHO is calling for #ClimateAction to assure a sustained recovery from #COVID19.

More on their recommendations, from protecting nature as the foundation of health to promoting food systems: https://t.co/TaFfli7aG6 https://t.co/9PnH2fnuGc

There are 476+ million indigenous people...
🔹 living in 90 countries
🔹 representing 5,000 different cultures
🔹 speaking the majority of the 🌎's 7,000 languages

Here's what the UN is doing to promote & protect their rights: https://t.co/lw7M71VGh0 #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/lEBrrjFPc2

"I am particularly alarmed to see promises made to Afghan women & girls by the Taliban being broken." 

-- @antonioguterres appeals to the Taliban to fulfill their obligations under international human rights & humanitarian law. https://t.co/hP6q6w2jmS https://t.co/7KcYpJSoBy

Online violence is violence. 

On Monday's #DayofTheGirl, join @UNFPA as they #StandUp4HumanRights and call for an end to all forms of online abuse!  https://t.co/RVJKqxPqgR https://t.co/UVATAyFVHo

Human trafficking happens in every country.

Refugees & other forcibly displaced people are particularly vulnerable to this crime & human rights violation.

See what UNHCR is doing to help #EndHumanTrafficking: https://t.co/OHnVIvnxUb via @refugees https://t.co/Uiq432Hn9W

Digital connectivity for girls is a matter of human rights.

On Monday's #DayOfTheGirl, join @UNFPA's call for making the Internet a safer and more inclusive space for everyone. https://t.co/RVJKqxPqgR #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/77LGR7Gljk

Biodiversity is in crisis. 

One million species are at risk of extinction due to human activity.

Starting on Monday, governments will meet at @UNBiodiversity Conference #COP15, where they need to commit to repairing our broken relationship with nature. https://t.co/aFhqySYB8g https://t.co/D998dQw9Xn

Girls face distinct economic & social barriers to accessing the Internet & digital devices. 

On Monday's #DayOfTheGirl, @UN_Women calls for targeted investments for equitable opportunities for girls to access, use, lead & design technology. https://t.co/dGEcTq6fqG https://t.co/HZfdut6Wdr

The struggle to #FightRacism cannot be successful without fair access to justice for all. This means:
🔹 Ending impunity for acts of racism
🔹 Ensuring equal access to legal assistance & justice for victims
🔹 Stopping spread of ideas based on racial superiority or hatred. https://t.co/j0VvLrhv6V

In some countries, rates of internet use among boys is 2 or 3 times higher than for girls.

On Monday's #DayofTheGirl, join @UNFPA in calling attention to the impact of the gender digital divide: https://t.co/rh8L50WGvb https://t.co/aXkhqfVPce

Climate change doesn't only mean warmer temperatures.

Check out our #ClimateAction fast facts to learn more about climate and
👷‍♂️jobs
🥕food
👩‍⚕️health
📈economy 
⚡️energy
💰finance 
and more: https://t.co/4l65ngxjrn https://t.co/DeJohTnbFK

Depression can happen to anybody.

It is an illness, not a sign of weakness - and it can be treated.

On Sunday's #WorldMentalHealthDay, @WHO shares advice on how to help those who may be suffering from depression: https://t.co/c31iCNuqNj https://t.co/1oWcKiBeO3

🛰️🔭🚀 As #WorldSpaceWeek comes to an end, see how 
@UNOOSA continues to promote international cooperation for the peaceful uses & exploration of outer space: https://t.co/L8Xscmuuuq https://t.co/B2DyL3J9W3

How are you ... really?

Dealing with the #COVID19 pandemic has been tough. Talking about how you feel with people you trust can help. 

On Sunday's #WorldMentalHealthDay, have a look at these conversation starters. https://t.co/qHFLLDzVHa

The death penalty does little to serve victims or deter crime. 

170 countries have either abolished the death penalty or introduced a moratorium on its use. 

More on Sunday's World Day against the Death Penalty: https://t.co/4RfFvqhmPg https://t.co/bboFQhvUxR

Tips for good mental health:

🏋🏽 Exercise regularly
🍲 Eat healthily
😴 Get enough sleep
🍺 Limit alcohol intake
🗣 Talk about your feelings

More resources from @WHO on Sunday's #WorldMentalHealthDay: https://t.co/5fnexdHZoj https://t.co/HTokG8FAOL

The death penalty does little to deter crime - and wrongful convictions are inevitable. 

It has no place in the 21st century. 

On Sunday's World Day against the Death Penalty, show your support for ending executions. https://t.co/AtIhxoewu7 https://t.co/TfvLzU0JLo

#COVID19 has increased the demand for mental health care. Yet, few people around the world have access to these vital services.

On Sunday's #WorldMentalHealthDay, @WHO calls for increased investment in mental health. https://t.co/xA43AxrPhM https://t.co/1JGHmHdogw

Countries have failed to provide mental health care at a time when #COVID19 has unveiled a growing need for these vital services.

@WHO global report urges to increase investment & scale up access to quality mental health care. https://t.co/5y5f1W6Oeq

The world lost about 14% of its corals between 2009 and 2018. 

They are facing an existential crisis due to the climate emergency and a range of local threats, including overfishing & unsustainable coastal development. via @UNEP
https://t.co/G7nrGbvPtC

Migratory birds are impacted by the triple planetary crisis of climate change, biodiversity loss and pollution.

On Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay & every day, #ActNow to address climate change & help protect these beautiful species. 

Here's how: https://t.co/qNyfy4RH6f https://t.co/QNS0OQqchM

The Canadian artist - and newest @WFP Goodwill Ambassador - will use his voice and platforms to advocate for ending hunger around the world. https://t.co/goe8i3KiYL https://t.co/HQiP20nOHC

Migratory birds connect not only ecosystems but also people and nations. We all have a responsibility to ensure the diverse habitats migratory birds transit are protected.

More on Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay: https://t.co/D7l3yPbnan https://t.co/HhPfY3qVXs

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/Z2xz5VjQIX https://t.co/qePKawbf1d

More from @UPU_UN on Saturday's #WorldPostDay: https://t.co/1s2V90R8zO https://t.co/zQvvM3HIMi

Learn more about these fascinating species on Saturday's #WorldMigratoryBirdDay: https://t.co/Xb5IFj6OhI https://t.co/dVgfReTX30
